Service: SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines

Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the SQL Server deployment, including database size, performance needs, high availability, and disaster recovery requirements.

Tasks.Task: Select SQL Server Edition and Licensing Model
Tasks.Task Description: Choose the appropriate SQL Server edition (e.g., Standard, Enterprise) and licensing model (e.g., pay-as-you-go or bring-your-own-license).
Plan the database architecture, including storage configuration, backup strategy, and network connectivity.
Create an Azure Virtual Machine with the required specifications (CPU, memory, storage) and pre-installed SQL Server.
Set up SQL Server configurations, including max memory, tempdb settings, and collation.
Enable security features such as Transparent Data Encryption (TDE), Always Encrypted, and configure firewalls and Network Security Groups (NSGs).

Tasks.Task: Set Up High Availability and Disaster Recovery
Tasks.Task Description: Configure high availability options such as Always On Availability Groups and set up disaster recovery mechanisms.
Set up automated backups and test the restore process to ensure data recovery capabilities.
Implement performance tuning measures such as indexing, query optimization, and monitoring resource usage.
Configure monitoring tools like Azure Monitor and SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) to track performance and set up alerts for critical events.
Conduct thorough testing of the SQL Server setup, including connectivity, performance, and failover scenarios.
Create detailed documentation of the SQL Server setup, including configurations, backup procedures, and troubleshooting steps.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and maintaining the SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines.
Ensure the SQL Server setup complies with organizational and regulatory standards. Set up auditing mechanisms to track access and changes.
Use Azure Monitor and SQL Server performance tools to continuously monitor database performance metrics such as CPU usage, memory consumption, and query execution times.
Regularly apply security patches and updates to SQL Server and the underlying operating system to protect against vulnerabilities.
Test and validate the integrity of database backups to ensure they can be restored successfully in case of data loss or corruption.
Track disk space usage on the virtual machine hosting SQL Server to ensure sufficient storage is available for database growth and operations.
Conduct regular security audits to ensure compliance with organizational policies and industry standards. Check for unauthorized access and vulnerabilities.
Review and update SQL Server configuration settings to align with best practices and changing application requirements.
Run regular health checks on SQL Server instances to identify and resolve issues such as database corruption or service interruptions.
Regularly rotate encryption keys used for securing sensitive data in SQL Server databases to enhance security.
Perform failover tests to ensure high availability configurations, such as Always On Availability Groups, function correctly.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new SQL Server features, best practices, and security measures.
